intro: Galium danubiale, commonly known as Danube bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and woodland edges. Galium danubiale is often found in riparian habitats and is adapted to nutrient-rich, clay soils.
